definitions: boxing weight division for fighters weighing up to 112 pounds
examples: The flyweight champion defended his title successfully last night
Many famous boxers started their careers in the flyweight division

definitions: heavy rotating wheel in machinery that stores rotational energy
examples: The engine's flywheel helps maintain smooth rotation between power strokes
A damaged flywheel can cause serious vibration problems

definitions: baby horse typically under one year of age
examples: The mare gave birth to a healthy foal this morning
The foal stayed close to its mother in the pasture

definitions: collection of small bubbles formed in liquid or solid
lightweight cellular material used for padding or insulation
examples: Sea foam collected along the beach after the storm
The cappuccino was topped with a layer of milk foam
The packaging contained protective foam to prevent damage
She bought a foam mattress for better sleep quality

definitions: decorative ornament attached to a watch chain
small pocket in clothing designed to hold a watch
small electronic device used for keyless entry or access control
examples: His grandfather's gold fob gleamed against his vest
The antique fob featured intricate engravings
He tucked his pocket watch into the fob of his waistcoat
The tailor added a special fob pocket to the vest
She waved her key fob to unlock the car remotely
Employees use security fobs to enter the building

definitions: process of directing attention or effort toward something specific
act of adjusting a lens to produce a clear image
examples: Focusing on the task requires eliminating all distractions
The team spent the morning focusing on quality improvements
The photographer spent time focusing before taking the shot
Automatic focusing makes digital cameras easier to use

definitions: process of directing attention or effort toward something specific
act of adjusting a lens to produce a clear image
examples: Focussing on customer needs improved their business strategy
The students had difficulty focussing during the long lecture
The telescope requires careful focussing to see distant stars
Manual focussing gives photographers more creative control

definitions: dried food such as hay or straw for livestock
material or information used as a basis for something
examples: The farmer stored fodder for the cattle's winter feeding
Fresh fodder was delivered to the barn every week
The scandal became fodder for late-night comedy shows
These statistics provide fodder for the debate

definitions: person or group actively opposed to or hostile toward someone
examples: The knight faced his foe on the battlefield
Former foes became allies during the crisis

definitions: thick cloud of tiny water droplets near ground level
examples: Dense fog reduced visibility on the highway this morning
The fog rolled in from the ocean at sunset

definitions: loud horn used to warn ships of danger in foggy conditions
examples: The foghorn's deep blast echoed across the harbor
Ships rely on foghorns when visibility is poor

definitions: very thin sheet of metal used for wrapping or cooking
light flexible sword used in the sport of fencing
person or thing that contrasts with and emphasizes another's qualities
examples: She wrapped the leftovers in aluminum foil
The chocolate was wrapped in decorative gold foil
The fencer practiced her technique with a foil
Competition foils must meet specific weight requirements
The villain served as a perfect foil to the hero
Her serious nature was a foil to his playful personality

definitions: act of preventing someone's plans from succeeding
process of applying thin metal sheets to a surface
examples: The security team succeeded in foiling the robbery attempt
Quick thinking was crucial in foiling their escape plan
The craftsman specialized in foiling antique book covers
Gold foiling adds elegance to wedding invitations

definitions: water-soluble B vitamin essential for cell division and DNA synthesis
examples: Pregnant women need adequate folate to prevent birth defects
Dark leafy greens are excellent sources of natural folate

definitions: cardboard or plastic cover for holding loose papers together
digital container for organizing files in a computer system
examples: She organized her tax documents in a manila folder
The lawyer carried several folders to the meeting
Create a new folder for your vacation photos
The download folder was getting cluttered with files

definitions: action of bending something over on itself
capability of being collapsed for storage or transport
examples: Precise folding is essential in origami art
She spent the afternoon folding laundry
The folding chairs saved space in the closet
We bought a folding table for camping trips

definitions: leaves of a plant or tree considered as a group
examples: The autumn foliage painted the hillside in brilliant colors
Dense foliage provided shade from the summer sun

definitions: book size made from sheets folded once creating four pages
page number in a book or manuscript
collection of artistic works or documents in portfolio form
examples: The library's rare books section contains several medieval folios
Shakespeare's First Folio is extremely valuable
Check the folio at the bottom of each page
The manuscript's folios were numbered consecutively
The photographer presented her folio to potential clients
His design folio showcased ten years of work

definitions: traditional beliefs, customs, and stories passed through generations by word of mouth
examples: Irish folklore includes many tales of leprechauns and fairies
The festival celebrates local folklore through music and dance

definitions: song that originates among common people and is passed down orally
examples: The choir performed traditional folksongs from various cultures
Bob Dylan transformed American folksongs into protest music

definitions: story originating in popular culture typically passed on by word of mouth
examples: Grandma told us folktales from her childhood village
Many folktales contain important moral lessons

definitions: small cavity or sac in the body especially one containing a hair root
examples: Each hair grows from its own follicle in the skin
The doctor examined the infected hair follicle

definitions: action or thing that continues or completes something done previously
examples: The doctor scheduled a followup appointment for next week
Please send a followup email after the meeting

definitions: lack of good sense or foolishness in thought or action
costly ornamental building with no practical purpose often in a garden
examples: It would be folly to ignore the warning signs
His youthful follies cost him dearly later
The estate features an eighteenth-century folly overlooking the lake
Gothic follies were popular in Victorian gardens

definitions: complete set of type of one particular design and size
stone basin in a church for baptismal water
examples: Choose a readable font for your presentation slides
The designer selected an elegant font for the wedding invitations
The medieval font stood near the church entrance
Babies are baptized at the marble font

definitions: any substance that can be used or prepared for use as food
examples: The warehouse stored various foodstuffs for distribution
Import regulations apply to all foodstuffs entering the country

definitions: person who plays football especially as a profession
examples: The young footballer signed with a premier league team
Professional footballers train rigorously throughout the season

definitions: narrow bridge designed for people to walk across
examples: A wooden footbridge spans the creek in the park
The footbridge provides safe passage over the highway

definitions: section at the bottom of a page containing information
foundation beam or wall that distributes building weight
examples: The document footer contains the page number and date
Edit the footer to include your company name
The concrete footer must cure before building the foundation
Proper footers prevent structural settling

definitions: low hill at the base of a mountain or mountain range
examples: The town nestled in the foothills of the Rocky Mountains
Wildflowers bloom in the foothills every spring

definitions: secure position from which further progress can be made
examples: The company gained a foothold in the Asian market
Rock climbers search for footholds on the cliff face

definitions: secure placement of feet or stable position
foundation or base on which something is built
position or status in relation to others
examples: She lost her footing on the icy sidewalk
Hikers should watch their footing on steep trails
The building needs proper footing to support its weight
Engineers inspected the bridge footings for damage
Everyone should be on equal footing in negotiations
The new policy puts small businesses on better footing

definitions: uniformed male servant who serves at table and answers the door
examples: The footman announced each guest as they arrived
Victorian households employed several footmen

definitions: note at the bottom of a page giving additional information
examples: The author added a footnote explaining the historical context
Academic papers require proper footnote citations

definitions: path for pedestrians especially through countryside
examples: The footpath winds through the meadow to the village
Public footpaths must be kept clear by landowners

definitions: mark left by a foot or shoe on a surface
impact of human activities on the environment
amount of space occupied by something
examples: Footprints in the sand led toward the water
Police found muddy footprints at the crime scene
Companies work to reduce their carbon footprint
Calculate your ecological footprint with this tool
The building has a small footprint but multiple floors
The software's memory footprint is minimal

definitions: outer coverings for feet including shoes, boots, and sandals
examples: Proper footwear is essential for hiking safety
The store specializes in athletic footwear

definitions: manner of moving the feet especially in sports or dancing
examples: The boxer's quick footwork helped him dodge punches
Ballet requires years of precise footwork training

definitions: man excessively concerned with his appearance and clothes
examples: The Restoration comedy featured a ridiculous fop as comic relief
He dressed like a fop with elaborate ruffles and ribbons

definitions: act of searching widely for food or provisions
food for horses and cattle especially when taken by browsing
examples: Bears forage for berries before winter hibernation
The soldiers had to forage for supplies
The pasture provides natural forage for the livestock
Farmers supplement winter forage with hay

definitions: person or animal that searches widely for food
examples: Urban foragers find edible plants in city parks
Bees are efficient foragers visiting hundreds of flowers daily

definitions: act of searching for and collecting food from wild sources
examples: Foraging for mushrooms requires expert knowledge
The course teaches safe foraging techniques

definitions: brief attempt or involvement in a new activity
sudden attack or raid into enemy territory
examples: Her foray into politics proved surprisingly successful
The company's foray into smartphones was short-lived
The cavalry made nightly forays behind enemy lines
Viking forays terrorized coastal settlements
